summary: Following the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, several countries declared periods of mourning as a sign of respect and solidarity. Mexico decreed a three-day mourning period, with their Foreign Minister attending the funeral. El Salvador also declared a three-day mourning period. The Iranian Foreign Office instructed Iranian missions to fly their flags at half-mast as a sign of mourning. These actions reflect the global impact of Kennedy's death and the widespread sense of loss felt internationally.
significance: The declarations of mourning periods by various countries underscore the global impact and significance of President Kennedy's assassination. These acts of solidarity highlight the respect and admiration Kennedy commanded on the international stage, and the profound sense of loss felt worldwide upon his death.
